required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Psoriasis Outcomes and Safety Events in Patients With Chronic Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis (RESPONSE)
clinical_study.official_title: Raptiva Epidemiologic Study of Psoriasis Outcomes and Safety Events in Patients With Chronic Moderate to Severe Plaque Psoriasis (RESPONSE)

brief_summary.textblock: This was a multicenter, prospective, 5-year surveillance study of approximately 5000 Raptiva-treated patients and approximately 500 non-Raptiva treated patients (formerly 2500 comparison patients who were treated with a biologic therapy other than Raptiva) with chronic moderate to severe plaque psoriasis who were candidates for treatment with Raptiva.

study_pop.textblock: managed care organizations, community or physician practices, and academic centers in the United States

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have ever had a physician's diagnosis of chronic moderate to severe plaque psoriasis and be a candidate for treatment with Raptiva
- Are being treated with or initiating Raptiva therapy at the time of enrollment
- Be able to provide written informed consent
- Be willing and able to fully to participate for the duration of patient follow-up (5 years)
Exclusion Criterion:
- Have previously received at least one dose of Raptiva and are not currently using or restarting treatment with Raptiva at the time of enrollment
